The United States Army has awarded Michelle Dyarman a Purple Heart, the honor American troops receive for being wounded in action.
Dyarman suffered the injury in a second, but receiving the Purple Heart took seven years.
Back in 2010, we told you her story of suffering a concussion in Baghdad.
Some commanders refused to give Purple Hearts to Dyarman and many other troops who got concussions because they did not think concussions were real injuries.

As a result of our report, the Army put out new guidelines for Purple Hearts, and this past week, the Army told us they have finally awarded the medal to almost 1,000 soldiers under the new rules, including Dyarman.
